title: Nawazuddin Siddiqui opens up about having a crush on his music teacher – watch video
text:
Nawazuddin Siddiqui Portfolio Photos 
Nawazuddin Siddiqui and Shweta Tripathi’s unusual love story in Haraamkhor has got mixed reactions. For those of you who don’t know, let me tell you that Haraamkhor is based on the love story that blooms between an old teacher – Shyam (Nawazuddin) and his younger student – Sandhya (Shweta). The movie showcases to us how they fall for each other, how they keep their relationship hidden and the issues that follow. While some have liked this concept, some have opposed it. In fact, the CBFC (Central Board of Film Certification) had banned the movie coz of this unusual plot. However, Nawazuddin begs to differ. In an EXCLUSIVE interview with us, the actor mentions how Haraamkhor is actually portraying the reality of life. He even mentions how he himself had a crush on one of his teachers. 
Talking about choosing the movie coz of its unique story, Nawazuddin mentioned, “It (the movie) is a reality. The kind of story (that we are showing) is happening everywhere in reality.” The actor also added that he was also fascinated by one of teachers, when he added, “Of course, I have fallen in love with my teacher. In every man’s life, it happens. You get fascinated by them.” ALSO READ – Haraamkhor movie review: Nawazuddin Siddiqui excels in the creepiest role of his career 
Elaborating on the teacher he had a crush on, he revealed, “I didn’t study in a school or college or university where a female teacher used to teach us, but when I was in the National School of Drama (NSD), we had a lot of female teachers. We had one particular music teacher, who made me go, ‘Oh My God!'” ALSO READ – Nawazuddin Siddiqui explains why Haraamkhor is NOT an abusive word – watch video 
Well, looks like we now know why Nawazuddin chose to take up Haraamkhor . Kudos to the star for taking up such an unusual topic and showcasing it on screen! Anyway, check out Haraamkhor in theatres near you right away… Published: January 13, 2017 10:25 pm Topics:
